solution_line_template: There were {initial_yield} x {yield_increase_percent} = <<{initial_yield}*{yield_increase_percent}={increase_first_harvest}>>{increase_first_harvest} sacks of rice increase after the first harvest.
So the total sack of rice that you can get on the next harvest {initial_yield} + {increase_first_harvest} = <<{initial_yield}+{increase_first_harvest}={yield_second_harvest}>>{yield_second_harvest}.

Therefore the total number of sacks of rice you will get on the first and second harvest is {initial_yield} + {yield_second_harvest} = <<{initial_yield}+{yield_second_harvest}={total_sacks}>>{total_sacks}.
